metadata.name: Block Storage #329
metadata.description:
VGAB::BLOCKS2/STORAGE

Generative Storage Blocks made with P5JS and random colors.

Save image as PNG with 's'.
Save image as JPG with 'S'.

Load 1x, 2x or 4x dimensions (2560 * 3840px) image with '1', '2' or '4'.

Remove / add white noise with 'n'.
Remove / add frames with 'f'.

** 4x pixelDensity tested only with Google Chrome **
** Blocks Series reserves always from the Block Office **


VGAB 2023 / CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Tangentum #47
metadata.description:
We live in a multiverse: an infinite-dimensional space of variants. Everything exists here. Everything is possible. Each subset of a multiverse has its own unique laws of physics, a set of rules, and its own distinct features.

Tangentum creates a projection of a random multiverse subset to a 2-dimensional plane. Each variation is a unique representation of the force field, that exists somewhere at some point in time.

This work starts a series of my visual exploration of functions, continuity, and boundedness, and I would love to share it with you.


Please use fullscreen or download artwork in high resolution for a better viewing experience.

Tested with Chrome 107, Safari, and Firefox. Chrome is recommended, other browsers are slower on this artwork.

Saving with high and ultra-high resolution may take a while, please be patient.


Made with love and p5js


Controls in fullscreen:
[1] - save PNG 2700 x 1800
[2] - save PNG 5400 x 3800
[3] - save PNG 10800 x 7600
[4] - save PNG 16200 x 11400

metadata.name: Serene Garden #93
metadata.description:
A Serene Garden is a peaceful and tranquil outdoor space designed to evoke feelings of calm and relaxation.

The overall design and atmosphere of a Serene Garden encourage reflection and contemplation, making it a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of daily life. It's a place where visitors can slow down, breathe deeply, and reconnect with nature. Whether through the gentle sound of a fountain, the fragrance of blooming flowers, or the rustle of leaves in the wind, a serene garden provides a sensory escape that soothes the mind and nourishes the soul.

As a features, there are 17 color palettes for flowers, beautifull handpicked gradient backgounds whitch are mixing with flower palettes and together gives pleasing expirience of render/output.

To download high quality image, open 'Live' and press "S" to save 2500x1800px



February 2023
Made with P5js

metadata.name: The Beauty of Discord #17
metadata.description:
This experimental artwork is a unique blend of human and machine inputs, showcasing the potential for collaboration between the two in the creative process. The human component of the piece is evident in the deliberate composition, choice of color, and the use of painting algorithms. Meanwhile, the machine component is represented by two powerful AI technologies. The first, ChatGPT3, generated a thought-provoking poem about the galaxies and cosmos, serving as the inspiration for the piece. The second, DALL-E 2, then used this poem as a prompt to create a stunning AI image, bringing the cosmic themes to life in a realistic and captivating way.

The combination of these two AI technologies, along with the human touch in the painting algorithms and composition, creates an artwork that is truly one-of-a-kind. The final product is not only visually stunning, but it also serves as a glimpse into the future of humanity and the possibilities of AI collaboration in art. The artwork is a testament to the beauty that can result from a seemingly discordant combination of human and machine inputs, and it invites us to consider the impact of technology on the creative process and the role of the human artist in the age of AI.

Artist notes:
Press s to download high-res images.
Press a to see the AI-generated image.
Press g to switch back to the paint.

Read more on the medium website:
shorturl.at/bkqW8

attributes.name: AI Generated Composition
attributes.value: The universe is a grand cosmic dance

metadata.name: Fragment Assembler #100
metadata.description:
Fragment Assembler is a chaos engine that creates complex abstract patterns and textures. As the artwork is drawn, it constantly recomposes itself during assembly with a series of displacement techniques, creating new forms and visual elements, while others get broken into pieces and textures. The work is orientation agnostic, and will display the output in portrait orientation on tall displays.

Intended to display on high resolution mode. The artwork renders with lower resolution by default to maintain compatibility with lower end devices. 

Press '2' to double the internal resolution (recommended).
Press 'h' to enable full internal resolution (requires a modern desktop computer).
Press space bar to reload the work.
Press 's' to save the output as PNG.
To render a 6k PNG, first press 'h', then save with 'p' (requires a modern desktop computer).


Made with p5.js & WebGL.
Best displayed with a modern desktop system & Chrome browser. 


Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: seekers #109
metadata.description:
Seekers is inspired by the view that is held by mathematical realism, that mathematical entities objectively exist independently of the human mind. Therefore, mathematical entities are not constructed by humans, but rather, are discovered by humans. This means, that also other intelligent beings would be able to discover the same entities.

In 'seekers', a set of complicated, computer-generated functions are used to render coloured spaces on a Cartesian plane. The mathematical space is being explored and discovered by a group of seekers, which hover and fly around within the layers of infinitely evolving shapes. The vicinity of a seeker also modifies the surrounding mathematical space, which means that the seekers will never reach the objective reality.

The generating functions are created using human-curated evolutionary algorithm following the idea demonstrated already in Karl Sims' paper 'Artificial Evolution for Computer Graphics' in 1991.

———

Features 29 generative base functions, 15 palettes in various modes. Some palettes have a special 'dark mode', where the seekers also slightly illuminate the otherwise darkened space.

----

Notes for viewer:

- The piece adapts to all screen sizes, although a fixed size can be defined by url parameters.

- The piece is preferably viewed full-screen. The resolution can be adjusted for best performance.

- The piece can be paused and high-resolution stills can be exported for printing.

- Video clips can be exported in webm format. For a high-resolution video, frames should be batch exported as PNG-sequence and rendered in a video editing software.

----

Controls: 

- Number keys from [1] to [8] adjust the resolution
- [space] pauses animation
- [s] exports a PNG with the current resolution
- [x] starts and stops recording of a webm clip (25mbps)
- [i] toggles display of frame number and resolution

----

URL parameters:

- &width={WIDTH}&height={HEIGHT} explicitly sets the render resolution to {WIDTH}x{HEIGHT}. Resolution controls do not work when dimensions are explicitly set.

- &rec={start},{end} batch records frames starting from {start} and ending at {end}. Can also be used to record stills. For example, if you want a still export from frame 300 in resolution 5000x3000, you can start the piece with url parameters &width=5000&height=3000&rec=300,300

----

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

Utilizes fxHash template by Karsten Schmidt
https://github.com/thi-ng/tpl-umbrella-fxhash
MIT License

Utilizes components from thi.ng umbrella by Karsten Schmidt
https://github.com/thi-ng/umbrella
Apache Software License 2.0

metadata.name: Tile Study #109
metadata.description:
This collection explores different ways of producing tiles, almost all rectangular.  There are eight types of tile designs produced in p5.js.  Please try out the variations!  It starts with a simple drawing of circles and/or lines.  Add texture.  Pick a tile design.  Finally, parts of the base drawing get pulled and placed in new places.  Firefox works but is slow; other browsers recommended.

After opening:
"2 - 5" for higher pixel densities.  The one that looks like a dart board maxes out at pixel density 4.  5 causes an error.
"s" to save a png.
Resizing the canvas sets it back to pixel density 1.

metadata.name: Wandering Nets Redux #8
metadata.description:
Wandering Nets Redux is a reissue of Wandering Nets (March 2022). Due to an unfortunate error in the original piece Wandering Nets no longer displays live inside the current fxhash UI. This restored and updated generative token is offered free to all collectors of the original, with some additional tweaks and capabilities.

January 2023

Original description as below:

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Wandering Nets is a digital kinetic light sculpture by Matt Ebb.

Networks of light are created and connected via random walks in space and colour. Emergent structures are revealed by the ambient interaction, tension and collision of these networks within themselves and orbiting shadowed spherical bodies.

The piece is the result of several months of custom development in realtime volume rendering. The scene data is generated in javascript and rendered with a bespoke GLSL raytracer - no external libraries are used.

This is a graphically intensive shader. By default it will adaptively adjust sampling quality to target 30fps, though a reasonably fast GPU is recommended for best results.

Mouse drag: Orbit the camera in 3D to explore compositions
[ and ] keys: Override the adaptive samples per pixel lower or higher to trade noise for framerate

March 2022

Update -
spacebar: Disturb the light positions

metadata.name: Phases 2 #100
metadata.description:
Generative music system.

Phasing is a compositional technique in which a repetitive phrase is played on two (or more) musical instruments, in steady but not identical tempi.

Click to start the music

@ramioso 2022-04-25

metadata.name: HERE & NOW: Edition 5 #597
metadata.description:
HERE & NOW: Edition 5 
Generative Art created by Liam Egan. 

This coin is your gateway to all Edition 5 experiences, including The Passage​: Pitch Drop​.

​THE PASSAGE: Pitch Drop
Each coin will allow you to mint 1x generative art ​inside ​THE PASSAGE​: Pitch Drop. ​​

HERE & NOW
​We ​take culture seriously and are curious what virtual explorations can do.​ ​With a proven history of creating captivating worlds and experiences, we invite you to explore new realms, delve into the creative mind, and collect unique collaborations, all exclusively accessible with this Coin.

For more information including links to our discord and socials:
https://hereandnow.events/

This token uses a combination of 3D models and generative fractals. The fractal component uses a KIFS fractal model in 3-dimensional space and renders using raymarching.

metadata.description:

Therefore, mathematical entities are not constructed by humans, but rather, are discovered by humans. This means, that also other intelligent beings would be able to discover the same entities.

In 'seekers', a set of complicated, computer-generated functions are used to render coloured spaces on a Cartesian plane. The mathematical space is being explored and discovered by a group of seekers, which hover and fly around within the layers of infinitely evolving shapes. metadata.name: Blind Gallery Club Membership #107
metadata.description:
The Blind Gallery Club is an art community that focuses on digital and generative art. 

Besides accessing the community, members get early access and discounts to the Blind Gallery events and special ways to experience the blind concept. 

Learn more: https://www.blindgallery.xyz/club

---
Generative art by Mark Knol (@mknol)

metadata.name: I wish for the metaverse ... #85
metadata.description:
I WISH FOR THE METAVERSE TO RINSE OFF OF ME is a collection about both the power and the infirmity of affirmations. Shamanic, mantra-like, willful, affirmations seek to map a desired direction. That is, until time and mind get in the way.  Within brief, passing moments, our minds are able to manifest conflicting wishes—and do so via declarative, convincing statements. 
 
This work plays inside the chasm that divides intention and action. If we don’t know what we want, how can we act? Without the commitment of mind along the vast axis of time, our affirmations risk becoming sloganistic, simplistic, unrealistic—wavering proclamations that announce our vulnerability. 
 
Key words in these algorithmic affirmations shift over time to reflect the way our minds fluctuate. By shuffling words, this collection also explores our fluid relation to language. How to construct meaningful lives, when signification changes, moment to moment, within our minds? 
 
I WISH FOR THE METAVERSE TO RINSE OFF OF ME is a performance of fragility, which is where our humanity—and our beauty—abounds. 

-spacebar will pause the animation

-return will resume the animation

metadata.name: Unit of me #7
metadata.description:
Just like a river, which is always flowing and changing, we are never the same from one moment to the next. Our individuality is composed of countless fragments, each with its unique size and color, that come together to form who we are at any given moment. These fragments constantly shift, some become more prominent and vibrant, while others fade into the background. We are constantly being molded and shaped by the passage of time, so that who we are today is not who we were yesterday, and will not be who we are tomorrow

13 color palettes
3 canvas proportion ratio
and more 3 different traits

Press S to save a .png

Created by Zamboni
Dec. 2022
